text:
The House passage of the MORE Act is historic. It‚Äôs the first time either chamber of Congress has voted to dramatically change federal marijuana laws in 50+ years. 

But it has no chance in the Senate. Here‚Äôs what to know, from @natsfert üëá

https://t.co/XVtOVbqYUg

name: politico
text:
First, here‚Äôs what the MORE Act would do: 
‚Ä¢ Remove federal penalties on marijuana
‚Ä¢ Expunge some records
‚Ä¢ Levy a tax on cannabis products
‚Ä¢ Create grant programs 

https://t.co/tPO1vdgaZU

name: politico
text: But the MORE Act won‚Äôt pass the Senate. There are just weeks left in this Congress, and Sen. Majority Leader Mitch McConnell has said he won‚Äôt consider voting on marijuana legalization. https://t.co/tPO1vdgaZU https://t.co/7rlHbbtZGc

name: politico
text:
So why did the House vote even happen? Democrats want this bill to send the message that marijuana is part of criminal justice reform ‚Äì especially to president-elect Biden, who is not pro-legalization.

More from @natsfert: https://t.co/tPO1vdgaZU
